download the course companion download the course companion %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides% cams table of contents understanding cams asset fabrication overview of the physical inventory process capital asset management system (cams) this module is approximately 10 minutes long
cams %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides%

invoicing collecting, reporting receivables related to the sale of goods and services to external (non-university) customers cams = capital asset management system %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides% to track capital equipment view/bookmark the cams document help page

invoicing collecting, reporting receivables related to the sale of goods and services to external (non-university) customers why cams? %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides% free-standing & movable assets useful life of 1+ year original acquisition value of 5k

invoicing collecting, reporting receivables related to the sale of goods and services to external (non-university) customers who works on cams? %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides% employees that maintain records for assets assigned to a custodial code asset representatives

invoicing collecting, reporting receivables related to the sale of goods and services to external (non-university) customers asset delegates %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides% can assign 3 asset delegates to assist with the equipment management process asset representatives

invoicing collecting, reporting receivables related to the sale of goods and services to external (non-university) customers %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides% you are also responsible for the university equipment employees are responsible for maintenance and security of university equipment

invoicing collecting, reporting receivables related to the sale of goods and services to external (non-university) customers how items are tracked? %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides% four-digit number assigned to a department at med center: custodial codes = cost centers

asset fabrication %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides%
%project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides% items configured and built by uc davis personnel and student body

items configured and built by uc davis personnel and student body what is the criteria for fabrication? not available on the open market free standing and movable total cost >$5k parts purchased from multiple vendor or multiple purchase orders built by department personnel it will be placed into service for 1+ year uc will retain title finish product will be one-of-a-kind item %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides%
items configured and built by uc davis personnel and student body before starting the fabrication fabrication justification form %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides%
items configured and built by uc davis personnel and student body decal asset fabrication document help %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides%
physical inventories %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides%

the university is required to track equipment at its original acquisition value for the entire time it is under the care of the university. physical inventories are due on october 31st every other year cycle 1 custodial codes inventories: 10/31 odd number years cycle 2 custodial codes inventories: 10/31 even number years %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides%
1 2 6 5 4 3 the equipment physical inventory cams %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides%

6 6 complete the equipment certification download and print the equipment certification form acquire signatures email the form to eqhelp@ucdavis.edu %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides% 5 5 update cams asset transfer global asset retirement global asset global (add) asset location global cams %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides% 4 4 properly dispose of excess aggiesurplus.ucdavis.edu asset global transfer document available on kfs asset retirement global (ar) %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides% 3 3 conduct physical inspection view each asset on the 375 report review: ucop tag # description manufacturer model # serial # location condition certify that decal is on the front of the item principal investigator %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides% 2 2 identify equipment assigned to custodial code run the equipment inventory listing (375) generate a list of the department assets %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides% 1 1 determine the custodial codes for your department - use the asset custodial code lookup define the asset representatives determine if physical inventory is due %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides% 1 1 1 1 2 2 2 2 6 6 6 6 5 5 5 5 4 4 4 4 3 3 3 3 the equipment physical inventory click the numbers to view each step of the process %project.slidenumber% of %project.totalslides% cams
